title: Between 1 October 2017 and 30 September 2018, will an armed group from Myanmar engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in Myanmar?
preds:
This IFP appears to attempt to determine when the active military ops in support of ethnic cleansing stopped.
and whether the Burmese military complied with UN Sec. General demand that Military operations ceased September 30
Based on Refugee flows, epidemiological data,and satellites imaging the systematic killing continued well into November
Although the campaign appears over, there are substantial Rohingya left in Myanmar (150,000)  ongoing atrocities cannot be ruled out to denial of access. No UN Security Council resolution is imminent. 
"Specifically, China’s ambassador to the UN, Wu Haitao, stressed the need for the international community to be patient with the government" Russia supports military as well
See
and despite calls UN for unfettered access 2 reuters reporters were arrested and   the regime has excluded journalists from Rakhine See https://www.nytimes.com/2017/12/13/world/asia/myanmar-rakhine-reporters.html?action=click&contentCollection=Asia%20Pacific&module=RelatedCoverage&region=EndOfArticle&pgtyp
and https://www.reuters.com/article/us-myanmar-journalists/u-n-chief-says-arrest-of-reuters-journalists-shows-erosion-of-press-freedom-in-myanmar-idUSKBN1E8183
a  comprehensive brief on the genocide campaign in Rakhine State is at https://theglobalobservatory.org/2017/10/rohingya-crisis-high-on-outrage-short-on-action/ (as of 10-13)

strongly think recent bbc.com documents October killings in excess of 1000
The impact of Tillerson's visit, Popes visit yet to be clear.
Hate to say this but at 100,000 people dead
8000 a month
See https://tribune.com.pk/story/1503524/situation-myanmar-textbook-example-ethnic-cleansing-un/
" 5 December 2017 – The United Nations human rights chief on Tuesday called for an international criminal probe into the perpetrators of the widespread and brutal attacks that have driven more than 600,000 Rohingya Muslims from Myanmar since August, noting that “elements of genocide” against the minority could not be ruled out.
There is little doubt that enough people will be murdered.  The open questions are about culpability and deadlines.  This is a very depressing thing to say.

http://www.reuters.com/article/us-myanmar-rohingya-general/myanmar-army-replaces-general-in-charge-of-rakhine-operation-idUSKBN1DD18S?il=0
Well, there you have it--the army say they are entirely innocent, and who would be so crass as to disbelief the military?  Meantime, they have replaced the general in charge.  Time will tell whether they are looking for a replacement who is (a) more bloodthirsty, (b) better behaved, or (c) cleverer at not getting found out.
I am changing my probability to 100% after seeing this video on CNN of Burmese refugees describing an exceedingly brutal butchering of civilians.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

The Myanmar military are exerting themselves to the utmost to make this number as soon as possible.  For our scoring purposes, it will matter whether people have to die within Myanmar or can expire from injuries, wounds, and diseases elsewhere, still chargeable to Myanmar officialdom.  It is best for all of us to work on remembering that they will be just as dead irrespective of their effect on our scores in this exercise.

I am estimating that deaths are well in excess of 1000 and documented daily
when you see  almost a hundred thousand more lined up ready to go
READY TO CROSS BORDER INTO BANGLA SEE BBC.COM IMPACT TODAY
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
As there aren't that many comments here yet: Why do you rate the risk that high?

This conflict has now reach the stage of what I think of as the 4 Rs.- revolt, repression, revenge and repeat.  It will be some time before that cycle is stopped and not before a lot of people have died.

I have images that should go to DIA/NRO
they add up to more than a thousand deaths
